t: Kellogg's Achieves Speed and Agility with AWS | Case Study | AWS
s: Needing a more robust application to track and model promotional costs, Kellogg's is now running SAP HANA on AWS, a move that will save $900,000 in IT costs over 5 years and speed deployment by 90 percent compared to traditional data-center solutions.

In October 2023, Kellogg Company finalized the separation of its North American cereal business, resulting in two independent, public companies – Kellanova and WK Kellogg Co

Kellogg Co. (K), known for its Kellogg's brand breakfast foods, is a global food company that sells cereals and snacks such as Cheez-It crackers, Pringles potato chips, and Eggo waffles. W.K. Kellogg founded Kellogg as Battle Creek Toasted Corn Flake Company in 1906.

t: Kellogg’s | History, Cereal, Products, & Facts | Britannica Money
s: Kellogg’s is a leading American producer of ready-to-eat cereals and other food products. Kellogg’s Corn Flakes was one of the earliest and remains one of the most popular breakfast cereals in the United States. The company is headquartered in Battle Creek, Michigan.
